channel.title: Preventing Talking
channel.description: Well, I wanted to know how to make it so that people below level 5 cannot talk to prevent SYI's. I know I have seen this done, but I have no clue on how to do it. If someone could just tell me which file this deals with, (server class, client class, etc..) I would greatly appreciate it.

item.title: Preventing Talking
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:25, topic:281729”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=372182.msg2810693#msg2810693 date=1243974660]

Yes.

NO! I was about to show him how to do it. Loser. <3
[/quote]
Too slow, Jason. ;)[/quote]
<3

Read full topic

item.title: Preventing Talking
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

            if(combat < 5) {
                sendMessage("You must be at least level 5 to talk.");
                return;
            }
            chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
            chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
            chatTextSize = (byte) (packetSize - 2);
            if (muted == 1) {
                sendMessage("You can't talk because you are muted!");
            } else {
                inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
                chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
                println_debug(
                        "Text [" + chatTextEffects + "," + chatTextColor + "]: "
                        + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2));
                chatlog();
                String playerchat = "[" + playerName + "]: "
                        + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2) + "";
                // println_debug("Text ["+chatTextEffects+","+chatTextColor+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2));
            }
            break;

That should do it.

Read full topic

item.title: Preventing Talking
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

Here is my Packet 4…

            chatTextEffects = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
            chatTextColor = inStream.readUnsignedByteS();
            chatTextSize = (byte) (packetSize - 2);
            if (muted == 1) {
                sendMessage("You can't talk because you are muted!");
            } else if (muted == 0) {
                inStream.readBytes_reverseA(chatText, chatTextSize, 0);
                chatTextUpdateRequired = true;
                println_debug(
                        "Text [" + chatTextEffects + "," + chatTextColor + "]: "
                        + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2));
                chatlog();
                String playerchat = "[" + playerName + "]: "
                        + misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize - 2) + "";
                // println_debug("Text ["+chatTextEffects+","+chatTextColor+"]: "+misc.textUnpack(chatText, packetSize-2));
            } else if (combat < 5) {
		    return;
		}
            break;

Read full topic

item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

No… I put in…

if (combat < 5) { return; }
It compiled correctly, but nothing changed on the server. I created a new account and it is level 3, but when I talk on it, I can still see it on another account. =/

Would I have to put it in the mute method?

item.title: Preventing Talking
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:14, topic:281729”][quote author=Newty link=topic=372182.msg2810553#msg2810553 date=1243971015]

if (Player.combatLevel <= 4) {
return;
}

If that doesn’t work try:

if (Player.getCombat().combatLevel <= 4) {
return;
}

[/quote]
Client is a subclass of Player so it will inherit all of it’s variables anyways, so there’s no need to reference the Player class directly.

@OP: Tell me if you can find any variables with “combat” in their name.[/quote]
It’s just ‘combat’. He sent me the source.

Read full topic

item.title: Preventing Talking
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:10, topic:281729”] if (Player.combatLevel <= 4) { return; }

If that doesn’t work try:

if (Player.getCombat().combatLevel <= 4) { return; } [/quote]
Client is a subclass of Player so it will inherit all of it’s variables anyways, so there’s no need to reference the Player class directly.

@OP: Tell me if you can find any variables with “combat” in their name.

Read full topic

item.title: Preventing Talking
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Try:

if (server.Player.combatLevel <= 4) {
return;
}

If that doesn’t work try:

if (server.Player.getCombat().combatLevel <= 4) {
return;
}

If that doesn’t work try making Player lowercase. Ex: server.player.combatLevel…

Read full topic
